alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Escambia; Mobile Inland; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 10:35PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, northeastern Mobile, northwestern Baldwin, southeastern Washington, southeastern Clarke, western Escambia and southwestern Conecuh Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1034 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Excel to 5 miles east of I65 And AL 21. Movement was west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Atmore, Stockton, McCullough, Uriah, Mount Vernon, Calvert, I65 And CR 1, I65 And AL 113, I65 And AL 21 and Poarch Creek Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Inland; Escambia; Mobile Inland; Washington
